risk_factors: Younger individuals are more likely to engage in risky behaviors, but this person is attending school and has not used drugs recently.
Being Black may have some impact on recidivism rates, but it's not a strong predictor.
Multiple arrests indicate a higher likelihood of future criminal behavior.
Attending school is positive, but the person has no job history which could be a risk factor.
No job history doesn't necessarily mean high recidivism, but it can be a risk factor.
No drug use in the past four years is good, but some drug use during the past month could indicate relapse.
Mental health issues can contribute to recidivism, but this person has had some ups and downs which is not uncommon.
Living in a large household with both biological parents at a young age could indicate a challenging upbringing.
Belief in God doesn't necessarily impact recidivism rates.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 4 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 10 inches and weighs 155 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He is enrolled in school at the present moment. He has held no jobs during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 7, in a rural area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
